Posts.Content: I've been trying on my wigs and they're just not looking right, maybe because I still have all my hair, thick as a mop. I've been thinking of wearing scarves more and more. I will wear hats too. But, like pitt, I will want to make my own, or have my sister make them. I'm thinking of tye-dying them. I've been on youtube looking at how to tie scarves and how to tie-dye fabric. I even watched how to make a scarf out of a tee shirt. Do you have any other ways to make scarves?
Posts.Title: clever ways to make scarves?

Posts.Content: I've never used them. Has anyone used them? How tricky are they to put on and are they re-usable? I'm thinking about trying them.
Posts.Title: false eyelashes

Posts.Content: I hope things go well for you. I was also misdiagnosed in the beginning, the boil in my armpit didn't feel like anything bad, she said.
Posts.Title: Here I am again

Posts.Content: My daughter likes to watch soccer. I tried, but what is that buzzing noise from the audience? Too much for me, but the players are great to watch.
Posts.Title: Looks like it's The Netherlands and Spain!!!! World Cup update!

Posts.Content: I believe the same . Prayers sent.
Posts.Title: surgery next wednesday

Posts.Content: Have any of you heard of this: taking your own hair and somehow gluing or attaching to a hat? I'm wondering how to do it. Maybe hot glue or something? I have plenty of hair and don't want to just throw it away. It's not long enough for locks of love, though. But, it could be used for bangs or something sticking out from a hat. My sister gave me the idea.
Posts.Title: When I cut my hair...

Posts.Content: I start mine on Monday, don't know the dosage. I hope it's a breeze, I'm worried about my nails and bone pain mainly. I guess it's a common regimen. Hope it works for us.
Posts.Title: Chemo cocktail ,taxottere,cytoxan

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your good thoughts and prayers! I have an appointment on Monday, so I wont know whats going on til then. Doctor is out of town this week and nurse is tight lipped. Hate that, don't you? Liver area feels bloated and tender and my digestion is out of sorts for sure, not much appetite right now. Hoping it's nothing too serious. I'll keep you all posted. Only 4 more days to wait!
Posts.Title: Liver catscan results on Monday

Posts.Content: I wish you and your family well.
Posts.Title: back to chemo on Monday 5/10/10

Posts.Content: My thoughts and prayers are with you.
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: My cancer was also said to be "invasive and aggressive". This was in Sept. I had a 4.4 cm tumor in right breast and an egg sized lymph node under arm. The chemo did it's job. I just had a lumpectomy on Tuesday and I'm cancer free today. For how long is another question. But for today, I'm glad. Chemo is a pain, but it can work wonders.
Posts.Title: BC reoccurence

Posts.Content: Prayers are with you too. Hope you feel better real soon. Chemo is horrible.
Posts.Title: Treatment plans, Side Effects, you Kindreds know, the usual!!!

Posts.Content: My thoughts and prayers are with you.
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: I don't have the watery eyes, but, like tgf, my nose bleeds when I blow it.
Posts.Title: Chemo Chicks

Posts.Content: I also don't like the compliments I know aren't really true. I know I look like I feel-not so great. Been really tired during the last 2 chemos, I'm glad they're over with. There's an elliptical collecting dust in my basement, I'm wanting to get back on it soon. I'm glad you're doing well and getting stronger. Keep posting.
Posts.Title: Facing forward - exercising again!

Posts.Content: Wish I could be there too. Beautiful pictures, you look great.
Posts.Title: new pix up

Posts.Content: While on 6 rounds of taxatere and cytoxin and steroids, I was also hungry all the time even when food didn't taste good. I gained 10 pounds over 4 months.
Posts.Title: Can't stop eating!

Posts.Content: Thanks for a beautiful prayer, this will become a daily one.
Posts.Title: Prayer for tonight (just a suggestion)

Posts.Content: Today was a great day. Path reports were clear. The doctor got it all. Next step is radiation in a month or so. Staples come out Wednesday and back to work on Thursday. I feel very little pain, just when I reach up for something. Doing laundry and mopping today. Nurse says I can do what I feel like without discomfort. I can shower now, too. To you ladies just beginning your treatment, good things will happen. Even on days when you're sick and beyond tired, you'll reach a day like the one I'm having today. My treatment started end of September and it's almost over.
Posts.Title: Glad to meet you, NED

Posts.Content: So happy everything went well. Have a quick recovery.
Posts.Title: Vicki Sam is home, resting and recovering -- Not too bad // Exchange went well this morning at 7:30, home by 1 p.m.

Posts.Content: I'm sorry to hear this. I know you'll be ok. You're very strong and positive.
Posts.Title: Just when I thought it was safe to go back in the water, I was bitten by Jaws! So to speak...

Posts.Content: I watch this from time to time and it always makes me laugh. In search box type "dad at comedy barn"
Posts.Title: funny skit on youtube

Posts.Content: I'm sorry to hear this. I know you'll be ok. You're very strong and positive.
Posts.Title: Just when I thought it was safe to go back in the water, I was bitten by Jaws! So to speak...

Posts.Content: I'm sorry to hear this. I know you'll be ok. You're very strong and positive.
Posts.Title: Just when I thought it was safe to go back in the water, I was bitten by Jaws! So to speak...

Posts.Content: I'm happy you're doing so well. Keep it up.
Yes, the bald look is different but manageable. Just a new routine. I'm 1/3 done with chemo. I'm feeling well. Thanks for posting.
Posts.Title: Hi Laurissa

Posts.Content: I just felt out of sorts because of the news, knowing things can happen so fast is scary.
Posts.Title: I have to escape for a while

Posts.Content: I'm still more scalp than hair and I'm ready to dye it already! Its salt and pepper. I'm too young for that. I hope it gets a growth spurt soon.
Posts.Title: It's the Hair

Posts.Content: Glad you're doing ok, Yukky sums it up. Hope your mom's ok too. The neulasta kicks in 36 hrs later. I remember when the jabbing pains started in my shins, I took vicadin for 3 days. Day 8 was my feel better day til the next treatment. Now its 7 months past chemo and I'm feeling good. Its hell going through it. I drink alot of green tea too, make about 4 teabags everday. Take care.
Posts.Title: 1st Chemo 2 days ago!

Posts.Content: Enjoy yourselves. You must have been 10 when you married you look so young!
Posts.Title: Our 35th anniversary

Posts.Content: I drive a schoolbus and need to work as much as I can. Is it still possible to drive or are the side effects too much to drive safely? My employer is very kind and will let me off when I need to be, but I need to work! I still don't know what chemo I will be getting.
Posts.Title: Chemo and driving?

Posts.Content: I hope and pray for a great ct scan. So many tests and waiting.
Posts.Title: Gas up the bus, girls!

Posts.Content: I finished #21 today and no problems yet.
Posts.Title: Update First visit to Radiation Onc

Posts.Content: Have a great time with ned and nert!
Posts.Title: Hands off, girls -- NED is all mine today!

Posts.Content: Me too. And I haven't had a period in 2 months. Chemo does something to the ovaries.
Posts.Title: Bald Headed Dictator

Posts.Content: Wishing you well with your surgery. I can only imagine what you're feeling, I won't be getting a mastectomy but a lumpectomy in about a month from now. I'd be scared, too. I'm sure you'll be fine. Post when you can.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy in 5 Days - Having a Hard Time Coming to Terms/Accepting it Emotionally

Posts.Content: Has anyone applied for ssdi? How long did it take to get it? I've applied for it about a month ago and just waiting. I know it can take months. Being out of work is not good. So much more to worry about. There's no way I could possibly work now, I can't even drive. I feel like I'm in a constant hangover, mornings are bad trying to get up and think about eating or doing anything, especially pet duty.
Posts.Title: stage 4 and disability

Posts.Content: My oncologist says I won't have to take tamoxifen since my tumors were only 5% positive. I didn't know there was a percentage. I just thought they were positive or negative. Did anyone else have a low percentage and didn't have to take it?
Posts.Title: No tamoxifen for me

Posts.Content: I got so tired of clumping I went to sister's and had it buzzed off. No picture yet. My "computer Einstein daughter" is working and not here to post pix. And my wig looks pretty good too, without all the hair. Kathy Scissorhands became Kathy Clipperhands. No tears at all, I was ready. It was gross falling out like that. You know when it's time! It's your turn natly! This dreadful stage is over.
Posts.Title: I'm BUZZED (clipper buzzed that is)

Posts.Content: I didn't lose my lashes or brows. They thinned out a bit but not enough to use false ones. I was on the same chemo as you, maybe you won't lose yours. Eyeliner and brow pencil were enough for me. I loved not having to shave! Thats a plus of chemo. I also got a free wig from the Cancer Society. I bought a few others too. It is a transition to go through, but you will be fine. I'm looking forward to the end of this hurdle! I'm about half way there.
Posts.Title: Brian Joseph's Lash & Brow Gel???
